DOC.brief_summary: This study aims to examine the effectiveness of three different ways of helping patients attend their recommended eye care appointments.
DOC.brief_title: Improving Follow-Up Adherence in a Primary Eye Care Setting
DOC.detailed_description: The three ways are 1) usual care, which involves a standard reminder letter; 2) automated telephone calls, which utilizes a machine to automatically call patients one month prior to their recommended follow-up date; 3)personalized telephone calls, which utilizes a staff member to personally call patients and offer them the opportunity to schedule at the time of the telephone call.
DOC.criteria: Age: Over 18 years Primary Eye Care Patients who were recommended for a 6month, 12month, or 24month followup appointment during September 2013 through November 2013. Access to a telephone Does not speak English
